meanings.definition: The act or process of aggregating.
meanings.sent1: The aggregation of data helps us analyze trends.
meanings.sent2: The aggregation of coins in the jar made it heavy.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's aggregation of stickers made the students excited.
meanings.sent4: The aggregation of stars in the night sky was breathtaking.
meanings.sent5: The aggregation of colorful balloons created a festive atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A collection or gathering of things.
meanings.sent1: The aggregation of toys in the playroom was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The aggregation of books on the shelf caught my eye.
meanings.sent3: The aggregation of seashells on the beach delighted the children.
meanings.sent4: The aggregation of clouds in the sky signaled an incoming storm.
meanings.sent5: The aggregation of leaves in the yard needed to be raked.

meanings.definition: The formation of a whole from separate parts.
meanings.sent1: The aggregation of ingredients resulted in a delicious cake.
meanings.sent2: The aggregation of players formed a strong team.
meanings.sent3: The aggregation of puzzle pieces revealed a beautiful picture.
meanings.sent4: The aggregation of voices in harmony created a mesmerizing song.
meanings.sent5: The aggregation of colors in the painting brought it to life.
